verses.roman:
śuniyā prabhura ānandita haila mana
rāma-dāsa viprera kathā ha-ila smaraṇa

synonyms: śuniyā—hearing this; prabhura—of Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu; ānandita—very happy; haila—became; mana—the mind; rāma-dāsa—of the name Rāmadāsa; viprera—with the brāhmaṇa; kathā—of the conversation; ha-ila—was; smaraṇa—remembrance.
translation: Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu was very glad to read about the false Sītā, and He remembered His meeting with Rāmadāsa Vipra, who was very sorry that mother Sītā had been kidnapped by Rāvaṇa.
